09CA05CDB3CE41AAA229656EDDF3CF52.description: Apply philosophical, political, and economic frameworks and lenses (Utilitarianism, Marxism, etc.) to different situations to assess their viability

E2E394360F63491BBD8C48E6D131290A.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

476461C0B41D43F088A431E28CA3E8F5.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

110D1243929A4E5CBC1269EF12120BE1.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

E2D703EF58624512AA8BE698E7A3E8B6.description: Evaluate how economic globalization and the expanding use of scarce resources contribute to conflict and cooperation within and among countries

ACB744CDC0E6401380044DED4348BA07.description: Present adaptations of arguments and explanations that feature evocative ideas and perspectives on issues and topics to reach a range of audiences and venues outside the classroom using print and oral technologies (e.g., posters, essays, letters, debates, speeches, reports, and maps) and digital technologies (e.g., Internet, social media, and digital documentary).

0D4066554200447A8F4CA79B5B19A653.description: Assess options for individual and collective action to address local, regional, and global problems by engaging in self-reflection, strategy identification, and complex causal reasoning.

04E6F6E268A94C8BACD062B23A5712B0.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with other.

99F8A6706BD84E3CBAAD978BB082C75A.description: Integrate quantitative or technical analysis (e.g., charts, research data) with qualitative analysis in print or digital text, to analyze information presented via different mediums.

53B09D10BEFB43C79F3C7D543AAA6A94.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

881D4AC22819497B82D3E8437D271ECF.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

49AB1DE49B054FEBA46314C9D139504A.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences and relevant connections from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

254BE94F8C424FEA8DAFBCBE7D5478BE.description: Use historical events and literary works from the past to craft positions on contemporary social, economic, political, and cultural issues
